definition: ranking/ordered list/top 20/roll of honor/to come nth out of 100
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees

sentences.english: Wenbo is currently officially ranked 53 in the world.
sentences.chinese: 文博在当前的国际官方排名榜上是第53名。

sentences.english: Now a frequent resident of many Sexiest Women In The World lists.
sentences.chinese: 现在是众多世界最性感女人排名榜的常客。

sentences.english: Showing the list destroys its accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 因此，显示排名榜会破坏统计的准确性。

sentences.english: Leaderboards create a problem for Wisdom of Crowds systems.
sentences.chinese: 排名榜给群众智慧系统制造了一个难题。

sentences.english: Ambrose Lee continues to score the highest while Stephen Lam remains at the bottom.
sentences.chinese: 李少光继续得分最高，而林瑞麟就继续排名榜末。

definition: notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees
to rank (number 1, or third last etc)/to be among (those who are in a particular group)
to stand above/to occupy an important position/to rank (among the top few)
position in a ranking of names/place/rank
to continue in a post/(to hold a post) several times in succession/(to win a title) in successive years/to stay at number one/to defend a championship
